item.title: What would you like to see in a book on the blockchain?
item.description:
What would you like to see in a book on the blockchain?

Answer: No, because blockchain needs many resources to be maintained. I would prefer small chunks of data to be stores on the blockchain, for wise resources use.

item.title: Vulture Capital Announces Benefits for VCAP Holders
item.description:
Vulture Capital Announces Benefits for VCAP Holders

Vulture Capital, the company behind the VCAP crowdsale aimed at funding a feature film titled Listen Carefully, has announced a list of benefits available to the film's cryptocurrency contributors. Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services.

item.title: Maximus Coin Offering Up to 300% Returns on Bitcoin Investments
item.description:
Maximus Coin Offering Up to 300% Returns on Bitcoin Investments

Maximus Coin, as the company is titled, is bringing the aforementioned claim to reality through its two cloud mining plans. A Bitcoin mining contract company has claimed that it is offering up to 300% returns on modest Bitcoin investments. Maximus Coin, as the company is titled, is bringing the aforementioned claim to reality through its two cloud mining plans.

item.title: TorStrike: A Proposal to Shut Down Tor's Network for 24 Hours
item.description:
TorStrike: A Proposal to Shut Down Tor's Network for 24 Hours

A group of protestors is asking the temporal blackout of Tor's network for 24 Hours. An initiative using the Twitter hashtag #torstrike and accusing the project leaders of working with the CIA, among other claims. Concretely, the group is asking users to avoid using the network on September 1st.

item.title: While you weren't watching, classic block share has crept back up to 5% * /r/btc
item.description:
While you weren't watching, classic block share has crept back up to 5% * /r/btc

It's actually 11 out of last 100, so something's stirring again...

item.title: Case Study: Filipino OFWs and Bitcoin
item.description:
Case Study: Filipino OFWs and Bitcoin

Working abroad has been no walk in the part for Louise*, 33, who originally hails from Manila, Philippines. She has been providing support services for a few international companies, and is now working at a travel agency in Kuala Lumpur.

item.title: US Nuclear Research Lab Developing Bitcoin Analysis Tool - CoinDesk
item.description:
US Nuclear Research Lab Developing Bitcoin Analysis Tool - CoinDesk

A federally funded research lab run by Lockheed Martin is developing a bitcoin analytics tool for the US Department of Homeland Security (DHS). The project, first detailed in a 19th August newsletter published by Sandia National Laboratories, marks a continuation of previously detailed efforts at the DHS.

item.title: Coda Pay Receives $2 Million for Asian Expansion - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Coda Pay Receives $2 Million for Asian Expansion - Bitcoin News

Singapore-based startup Also read: Amazon-Rival Rakuten Forms Blockchain Lab Coda Pay is bringing Bitcoin and alternative payment processing to South East Asian markets with its recent capital injection. The company has just announced it has raised $2 million USD to push its efforts forward.

item.title: If You Want To Buy Bitcoin, Avoid Greyscale Bitcoin Investment Trust For Now
item.description:
If You Want To Buy Bitcoin, Avoid Greyscale Bitcoin Investment Trust For Now

There are only a limited number of ways to get exposure to Bitcoin on the public markets right now. Until the Winklevoss twins are able to launch their COIN exchange traded fund, options are limited for investors who want access to Bitcoin.

item.title: GDAX Users Can Now Trade Litecoin Against USD and Bitcoin
item.description:
GDAX Users Can Now Trade Litecoin Against USD and Bitcoin

Although it had been a rumour for quite some time now, the Litecoin community will rejoice at the news GDAX has added LTC trading. This news is great for the community, although it does not give Litecoin any more usability than it had before. Moreover, the volumes on GDX are small to nonexistent right now.
